Wilson Plumbing & Drainage takes safety seriously and we encourage all persons representing the company to speak up if something is not right. If you find yourself unsure about something when it comes to safety, ASK! There is no such thing as a stupid question.
Sign Off – By signing this page you acknowledge your attendance of this toolbox meeting and your co-operation with our policies & procedures

OHS Form 21-A - Confined Space Entry Permit - Checklist
Pre-Entry Preparation
Have all workers involved in the task read, and signed the SWMS
Has the gas monitor been calibrated and current sticker on unit
Is all Confined Space equipment being used in good condition
Is recovery equipment deployed at the entrance of the Confined space
Are hazardous fumes being creating near entry of Confined Space
Is mechanical ventilation required
Has the fan being used been tested and tagged and in good condition
Is there a risk of services discharging into confined space
If yes, have these services been isolated and locked out
Emergency Preparation
Has the separate Confined Space Entry Permit been completed (OHS Form21-B)
Has the Standby person signed into Entry Permit
Has the Standby person read and signed into current SWMS
Does the Standby person have effective communications with entrants
Does the Stand by person have Emergency services contact number
Have entrants been trained in the safe entry of Confined Space
Have combustible materials been removed from the entry
Entering Confined Space
Is signage in place near the entrance of Confined Space
Is adequate access and egress provided to entrance
Does any water/liquid need to be pumped out prior to entry
Is adequate supply of fresh air available for the duration of the entry
Is a charged fire extinguisher at the entrance of confined space
Is a first aid kit available if required
Has Client and/or Principal Contractor been briefed on nature of works
OHS Form 21-B - Entry permit
Details
Details - Pass once entered
Written Authority completed by
Date & Time (DD/MM/YY - 00:00 pm/am)
Description and location of confined space
Description of work
Air Quality Requirements
Gas monitor tested before use
Gas monitor fresh air test done
Date of Gas Monitor Calibration
Oxygen level % by volume - Must be between 19.5% & 23.5%
Flammable LEL - Must be below 5% to enter
CO - Must be below 35ppm to enter
H25 - Must be below 10 ppm to enter
Signature of competent person to be added here
Isolation
Does the space need to be isolated from any of the below - Pass once completed
Water/Gas/Steam/Chemicals
Mechanical/Electrical drives
Auto fire extinguisher systems
Sludge/Deposits/Waste
Locks and tags fitted to isolation points
Hot Works
Area clear of all combustibles including atmosphere
Is there appropriate fire prevention equipment available
Suitable access and egress
Hot work permitted (hot work permit filled out if required)

OHS Form 10 - Subcontractor Compulsory Start Up Meeting Agenda
Part A - Details
Details - Pass once entered
This document is not a contract. Its purpose is to establish and agree upon OH&S requirements prior to any mobilisation to site
This compulsory Start-Up Meeting process is applicable to all Sub-contractors engaged to carry out the any works whatsoever and as deemed necessary by the Wilson Plumbing and Drainage Project Manager
Project
Trade
Company Name
ABN
Site contact person
Phone
Name of person completing this form
Position
Part B - Administration Requirements
Please supply Wilson Plumbing the following documentation prior to site mobilisation - Pass once completed
Administration requirements - Pas once each of the below is received (Attach below)
Workers Compensation Certificate of Currency
Superannuation scheme Certificate of Currency
Long Service Leave Scheme Certificate of Currency
Redundancy scheme Certificate of Currency
Public liability Certificate of Currency
Will certificates of currency for the above schemes be provided monthly?
Has your company received any prohibition notices from Worksafe
If Yes to the above, please provide details
Has your company ever been prosecuted or are there any prosecutions pending for breach of Health and Safety Act? 4. If yes, please provide details.
If Yes to the above, please provide details
Does your company confirm they will comply with labour laws related to legal age of workforce, and all employees will be eligible to work in Australia as per Immigration laws
Is your company fully aware of its responsibilities under the applicable health and safety laws and regulations
The subcontractor agrees that all their employees attending site will have obtained a National Crime Check, no older than 6 months and evidence provided prior to site mobilisation
Part C - Site Compliance
Please pass once you have confirmed/supplied the below
Please add any comments below as applicable or required
The subcontractor must provide Safe Work Method Statements (SWMS) for all high-risk work being performed
The subcontractor must provide Material Safety Data Sheets (MSDS), no more than 5 years old from the date of issue, for any hazardous substance/chemical used on site
The subcontractor agrees that employees attending site will have completed the mandatory Construction Induction (White Card) Training and evidence shown upon request
The subcontractor will ensure their site employees attend a site-specific induction upon arrival to site for the first time
The subcontractor agrees to adhere to all site safety policies and procedures, including Wilson Plumbing & Drainages’ site OHS Management Plan
The subcontractor will ensure all employees are inducted into work procedures/SWMS provided for site prior to commencement of task
The subcontractor agrees they will always provide suitably qualified and competent supervision
The subcontractor will ensure all employees attending site have received adequate training and hold appropriate qualification to perform tasks under their contract scope of works
The subcontractor agrees to provide appropriate safety equipment/PPE to its employees and ensure PPE is used correctly as per site requirements
The subcontractor agrees to report their workforce numbers to Wilson Plumbing & Drainage Site foreman at the beginning of every shift for emergency evacuation purposes
The subcontractor agrees to report all incidents/injuries to Wilson Plumbing & Drainage without delay
The subcontractor agrees to have all electrical tools and equipment tested and tagged, in good working order and will supply electrical register upon request

The subcontractor agrees all plant and equipment brought to site shall be in good working order as per manufacturer’s specifications/recommendations with all guards, locking devices, safety pins etc. in place
The subcontractor agrees to provide current plant risk assessment, no older than 12 months for all plant (including scissor lift) prior to operating on site

The subcontractor agrees that all plant operators are to complete daily operators checks, recorded in log book prior to use and be submitted upon request along with any service reports/documented repairs carried out
The subcontractor agrees to provide testing certification for all lifting gear used on site
The subcontractor agrees that any items identified through the OHS consultative process or weekly site inspection pertaining to their trade will be closed out within the set timeframe
The subcontractor agrees to attend daily prestart briefings and regular toolbox meetings conducted by Wilson Plumbing & Drainage and/or the Principal Contractor
The subcontractor agrees that failure to maintain appropriate housekeeping may result in cleaning costs be charged onto your company
Will the Subcontractor be subletting any part of the works
If Yes to the above, please provide details
Note - All secondary subcontractors engaged by the subcontractor shall meet the same requirements
Subcontractor Injury Statistics
Number of LTI's
Lost Time Injury (LTI)= An occurrence that resulted in a fatality, permanent disability or time lost from work of one day/shift or more
Number of MTI's

A Medical Treatment Injury (MTI)= A work-related injury resulting in the management and care of a patient to combat disease or disorder,
Including any loss of consciousness
LTIFR
Lost Time Injury Frequency Rate (LTIFR)= Number of LTI’s multiplied by 1 million and then divide the result by the number of hours worked
Sign-Off
I acknowledge that by signing the below, I fully understand and agree to abide by Wilson Plumbing & Drainage Health and Safety requirements and expectations they have for their subcontractors

Role
Wilson Plumbing Representative Sign Off - Signature added below

Ladder Inspection Checklist
Inspection Details
Please Inspect the below items for each ladder
STILES: Not warped, cracked, twisted, split, bent, crushed or with cracked welds or missing rivets
STEPS: Not bent, missing, loose, damaged or worn
FEET: Not missing, damaged or worn
PLATFORM: Not damaged or cracked
LOCKING BARS: No components missing, bent or the fixings are worn or damaged
HINGES & BRACKETS: Fixings not loose, missing or damaged
OTHER: Do not use if there is evidence of corrosion, or other damage that could affect safety

OHS Form 19 - Plant Introduction Checklist
All required documents have been provided
Item of plant
Plant Provider/Supplier
Plant Risk Assessment

The Plant Hazard Identification Checklist identify general hazards relating to the use of the machine, such as e.g. entanglement, crushing, striking and electrical, etc. The checklist should then detail the means of eliminating that hazard and is only valid for 12 months
Logbook
A current logbook recording daily safety pre-start checks. These are subject to inspection by Wilson Plumbing and Drainage Pty Ltd
Maintenance History

Proof of ongoing maintenance, i.e. maintenance records. The records should note the most recent inspection date and who conducted the inspection. It may also describe any repair work carried out on the plant. Most importantly, there should be no outstanding items noted for repairs
Operator's Manual
An operator’s manual relevant to the item of plant and which is to be kept with the item of plant
